page.title: 13 KIRK IRETON WAKES
page.content: Wakes is a very old custom. People used to watch in Church the night before the Saint's Day to which the church was dedicated. Kirk Ireton's church is Holy Trinity, so Wakes Week follows Trinity Sunday. On Trinity Sunday people march behind the banner of the Friendly Society to church. There may be many different events during the week, like a concert in the church, a treasure hunt, a disco, a darts match and a cheese and wine party. The main event takes place on the Saturday. A decorated lorry carries three Wakes Princesses from the Primary school, followed by other floats and people in fancy dress, in procession round the village. There are prizes for the best. The main street is full of stalls and there are sideshows too. The children dance round the maypole.
